image.altText: A smiling woman wearing a yellow top stands in front of a field of yellow flowers

props.synopsis: An Adelaide mother accused of attempting to murder her two young sons on a roadside was experiencing an episode of psychosis, characterised by delusional thoughts, at the time of the incident, a court hears.

title.children: Mum accused of stabbing young sons told police she was 'proud', court hears

image.altText: A train nearly hits a pedestrian.

props.synopsis: Footage of near-fatal incidents from across Adelaide's rail network has been released as transport authorities roll out a campaign urging pedestrians to be more cautious around trains and trams.

title.children: 'Confronting' videos of train and tram close calls released to highlight dangers of distraction

image.altText: three kittens in a yard

props.synopsis: Animal rescue volunteers say the shock closure of the only RSPCA shelter on the Lower Eyre Peninsula will worsen Port Lincoln's abandoned cat problem.

title.children: City 'overrun' by abandoned cats to lose only RSPCA shelter

image.altText: Arisa Trew with her Olympic gold medal in Paris.

props.synopsis: At just 14 years of age, Arisa Trew shows cools nerves to win the women's park final and eclipse a milestone that has stood since the 1956 Melbourne Olympics, while Australia sets a world record in track cycling's team pursuit. Follow live.

title.children: Skateboarder Arisa Trew becomes Australia's youngest gold medallist, as Aussie cyclists smash a world record

image.altText: Tim Walz speaks in front of an American flag.

props.synopsis: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris selects Minnesota Governor Tim Walz to be her running mate in the 2024 election.

title.children: Kamala Harris names Tim Walz as her vice-presidential running mate for 2024 US election

image.altText: An older woman with a dark grey bob and glasses speaks into a small microphone in front of a blue screen.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank has kept rates steady at 4.35 per cent for another six weeks, amid a dramatic spike in volatility in financial and stock markets.

title.children: RBA says no cuts expected in next six months after leaving interest rates on hold

image.altText: Australian authorities approach a suspected illegal fishing boat spotted at Kuri Bay in far northern WA.

props.synopsis: Australian authorities have responded after local tour guides and traditional owners spotted four boats moored at Kuri Bay in far northern WA.

title.children: Border protection officials intercept four boats in far northern Western Australia

image.altText: Joint sitting thumbnail

props.synopsis: The dismissal of the Whitlam government in 1975 has long overshadowed another monumental event in Australian political history from that era.

title.children: It's 50 years since Whitlam used a political 'last resort' that changed Australia

image.altText: A beagle laying on a mat.

props.synopsis: A widespread social media search has led to the discovery of a beagle who went missing for six days after escaping from a dog grooming business in Adelaide's south.

title.children: Social media reunites lost dog with owners after escaping from groomer almost a week ago

image.altText: A mobile phone is held in a person's hand at the ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: It has been a wild couple of days on the Australian (and global) share market. We've answered some of your most pressing questions about how we got here.

title.children: From a massive sell-off to closing on a high. How the last few days on the market have unfolded

image.altText: A painting of an 1850s ship.

props.synopsis: In a time well before instant communication in 1859, it took days for word of the Admella shipwreck to reach authorities, during which survivors were stranded with no food and water.

title.children: How a standard sailing trip from Adelaide to Melbourne become SA's worst maritime disaster

image.altText: A smiling woman holds a mobile phone in her right hand with the Ambient Menu web app open.

props.synopsis: Have you ever struggled to hear a conversation over the din of a lively restaurant? For people with hearing loss, socialising in loud restaurants creates significant challenges — but an Adelaide audiologist hopes her app will help match people with acoustically-friendly venues.

title.children: SA app helps people find conversation-friendly restaurants

image.altText: A large white dome that houses low-level radioactive waste.

props.synopsis: For decades, the issue of where to put Australia's nuclear waste has caused friction in regional communities and frustration for federal politicians on both sides. A possible solution has now emerged.

title.children: In WA's outback, a private company has managed to succeed where governments have not

image.altText: A protestor holds a Bangladesh flag in front of a flaming car in Dhaka

props.synopsis: The weeks of protests have come to fruition, at a heavy cost. What do Bangladeshis want now?

title.children: What next after the removal of Bangladesh's 'Iron Lady'?

image.altText: a group of male students wearing backpacks walk through a uni campus away from the camera. their faces can't be seen

props.synopsis: The number of visas being granted to international students has already dropped by 23 per cent, according to Universities Australia, as the government pushes ahead with plans to cap international enrolments.

title.children: 'They're considering more welcoming countries': Falling international student numbers spark warnings of job cuts

image.altText: Elon Musk

props.synopsis: A UK government minister criticised American tech billionaire Elon Musk on Tuesday for "unacceptable" comments on social media about the far-right riots gripping England and Northern Ireland.

title.children: 'Deeply irresponsible': UK justice minister slams Musk for comments about riots

image.altText: A shot of the Trains's house from the front.

props.synopsis: A senior officer described the extremists' property where three people were killed as a "stronghold", an inquest has heard.

title.children: Main sniper hide in Wieambilla shootout had hand-strengthening device and The Godfather book inside, inquest hears

image.altText: Australian Olympic diver Melissa Wu in mid-air in the tuck position with yellow and white circle graphics around her.

props.synopsis: As two Aussies head into the 10m diving finals, put your armchair critic skills to the test and see whether you can match our Olympic judge.

title.children: Melissa hits the water at 60kph — can you judge whether she nails a dive?

image.altText: Happy family photo with Cape York sign behind.

props.synopsis: David Hogbin, 40, disappeared after falling into the Annan River on Saturday. He was with family members when the incident occurred.

title.children: Newcastle doctor named as Far North Queensland croc attack victim

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes have won today — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here's the medal standings for day 11 of the Olympic Games

image.altText: RBA Anthony Albanese, Michele Bullock, Jim Chalmers 20230714_002920470_iOS

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank's decision to leave interest rates unchanged is the latest in a series of fizzers.

title.children: What happens next in the economy? Here's the good news and the bad news

image.altText: An aerial image of an airboat travelling across a flood plain in Kakadu National Park.

props.synopsis: Energy Resources Australia (ERA) has launched legal action against the Commonwealth and NT governments over a decision not to renew its lease over the Jabiluka uranium mine.

title.children: Mining company launches legal action after failed bid to extend uranium mine lease near Kakadu

image.altText: Danniel Lyon in an army uniform holding his son and his wife Caitland in a white jumper holding a baby

props.synopsis: An expert in fatigue management has told an inquiry looking into the Taipan helicopter crash that some ADF crews are continuing training despite fatigue recommendations suggesting otherwise, echoing similar concerns made those who died in the crash.

title.children: Inquiry hears there's a 'lack of understanding' about impacts of fatigue on soldiers

image.altText: A youngish man in a suit adjusts a facemask.

props.synopsis: The former NSW premier reflected on the mandate during his tenure in a speech given during his last week in parliament.

title.children: Perrottet declares pandemic vaccine mandates as 'wrong' in valedictory speech

image.altText: An Olympics official bends down to place a discus in the sun roof of an RC

props.synopsis: Those small cars darting across the background of track and field events have a big role behind the scenes. Here's what they do.

title.children: Have you spotted a mini car at the Olympics? They serve an important purpose

image.altText: Australian Opposition Leader Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: The federal opposition leader said it would be a "disaster" if the government were returned in a minority due, in part, to "Muslim candidates from Western Sydney".

title.children: 'Reinforcing harmful stereotypes': Religious vilification complaint lodged against Peter Dutton

image.altText: Two people stand and take questions from waiting media outside a court building

props.synopsis: Posts on social media, including an Instagram story uploaded on Monday by Brittany Higgins, have triggered Linda Reynolds's lawyer to claim there was a "co-ordinated plan" afoot to mislead the public during their high-profile defamation trial.

title.children: Brittany Higgins Instagram post during defamation trial draws ire of Linda Reynolds lawyer

image.altText: A white hurricane cloud cluster with a long tail is seen from space over a blue-green ocean with the US visible underneath

props.synopsis: The weather system continued to batter coastal regions with flooding and high winds as it was downgraded on Monday to a tropical storm.

title.children: Hurricane Debby makes landfall as US south flooded — warning of 'once-in-a-thousand-year' rain event

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks sternly off to the distance.

props.synopsis: Iran's ambassador to Australia is confronted over remarks calling for "wiping out the Zionist plague", amid fears Iran may soon retaliate to the assassination of one of terror group Hamas' political leaders.

title.children: Iran's ambassador 'called in' over tweet about removing Israelis from Palestinian 'holy lands'

image.altText: A woman in a wide-brimmed hat sits on a deckchair on a sandy beach, watching the ocean.

props.synopsis: Paid long service leave remains an entrenched Australian value and serves to reward long-serving employees, including casual and part-time workers, by providing them with an extended period of additional paid time-off. But what exactly are your entitlements?

title.children: Are you entitled to long service leave and how do you access it?

image.altText: A person voting at a booth in the ACT election

props.synopsis: Booming Chinese and South Asian migrant communities are keen to engage in Australian democracy but many do not fully understand how politics works in their adopted home country, new research has shown.

title.children: 'Set up by white Englishmen, for white Englishmen': Why Australia's political system is inaccessible for many migrants

image.altText: A restaurant with the sign Sushi Bay out the front.

props.synopsis: In her judgement, Federal Court Justice Anna Katzmann said the case showed the "exploitation of immigrant workers and a shameless but ultimately unsuccessful attempt to conceal it".

title.children: 'Calculated and audacious': Sushi Bay owner and companies fined $15.3 million for exploiting workers

image.altText: View of a palm tree-lined road with a yellow middle strip in California leading into the horizon.

props.synopsis: California, known for palm tree-lined boulevards and the iconic Hollywood hills, is adding another claim to fame: renewable energy. And the Golden State could offer a glimpse into the crystal ball of Australia's energy future.

title.children: In California, big batteries are eating into gas demand, showing how Australia could harness its solar power glut
